intro: Dicliptera setigera, commonly known as the slender grassvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish flowers. It is typically found in disturbed soils and open habitats, often in temperate regions. Dicliptera setigera is valued for its role in soil stabilization and as a forage plant for livestock.
